experiment: F9-NK S335 — domain expansion candidates + zero-in-degree sink sprint assessment
title: F9-NK: 5 domains with NK-analyzable coupling structures identified; sink sprint strategy assessed
expect: F9-NK new domain candidates identified + zero-in-degree sink sprint assessment
actual: CONFIRMED. 5 domain candidates identified with concrete NK-analyzable coupling structures. Sink count updated to 158 (39.4%) at N=401. K_avg=1.5611 (still above 1.5 threshold). Sprint strategy: hybrid (synthesis lessons + spot-citation edits).
diff: K_avg rose slightly to 1.5611 from 1.5452 at N=398 (N grew to 401 organically). Sink fraction held at ~39% — new lessons arriving as sinks faster than citation sprints close the gap. This confirms the structural tension: quality gate prevents outgoing orphans but has no control over incoming orphans. Protocol-level NK analysis was not previously attempted — revealed K_avg=4.17 (full-mesh) for bridge files and K_avg=2.86 (high-coupling) for governance authority chain, both with detectable cycles.

f9_nk_domain_candidates.coupling_structure: Authority chain cross-reference graph (SWARM.md, CORE.md, DEPS.md, INVARIANTS.md, FRONTIER.md, SWARM-LANES.md, NEXT.md)
f9_nk_domain_candidates.what_we_found: SWARM.md and NEXT.md are the highest-coupling nodes. NEXT.md references all 6 other files. SWARM.md is the authority root (4 outgoing, 0 incoming from this set). 4 mutual cycles exist — notably SWARM.md <-> CORE.md cross-reference each other.
f9_nk_domain_candidates.nk_prediction: Healthy authority chain = K_avg < 2, zero cycles. Measured K_avg=2.86 with 4 cycles indicates moderate coupling pressure on governance structure. NEXT.md as K=6 hub is a coordination bottleneck risk.
f9_nk_domain_candidates.testable_frontier: F-GOV-NK1: Does governance authority K_avg predict enforcement reliability? Test: correlation between K_avg of governance authority chain and drift events per session window.
f9_nk_domain_candidates.priority: HIGH — governance coupling directly impacts swarm coordination quality; cycles in authority chain = unresolvable precedence conflicts

f9_nk_domain_candidates.coupling_structure: Lane dependency graph (blocked-by relationships in SWARM-LANES.md)
f9_nk_domain_candidates.K_avg_measured: unmeasured — lane blocking not currently tracked as explicit edges
f9_nk_domain_candidates.what_we_found: Lane dependency graph is implicitly present in SWARM-LANES.md blocked-by fields but no NK tool processes it. F-OPS1/F-OPS2 tools (f_ops1_wip_limit.py, f_ops2_domain_priority.py) exist but do not compute K_avg or cycle count for lane dependencies.
f9_nk_domain_candidates.nk_prediction: K_avg > 1.5 in lane dependency graph = deadlock risk. K_avg < 1.0 = lanes too isolated (no coordination benefit). Target: 0.5-1.0 (sparse, healthy coupling).
f9_nk_domain_candidates.testable_frontier: F-OPS-NK1: Instrument lane dependency parsing in f_ops1_wip_limit.py to compute K_avg and cycle count over session windows. Cycle = scheduling deadlock signature.
f9_nk_domain_candidates.priority: HIGH — direct operational impact; lane deadlocks are currently undetected structurally

f9_nk_domain_candidates.coupling_structure: Bridge file peer-mesh (CLAUDE.md, AGENTS.md, .cursorrules, GEMINI.md, .windsurfrules all mutually referencing each other + SWARM.md as authority root)
f9_nk_domain_candidates.what_we_found: Bridge files form a full-mesh citation graph (K_avg=4.17, 10 mutual cycles). SWARM.md is isolated root (0 outgoing to peers, all others cite it). This is structurally expected for peer-protocol files but means any change to one bridge file should propagate to all 5 others — high maintenance burden encoded in the coupling topology.
f9_nk_domain_candidates.nk_prediction: Full-mesh is an NK complexity ratchet for protocol maintenance: each edit to one bridge file has K=5 dependent files that should be checked. Composite score=35 is high for N=6. As bridge files grow, this becomes a bottleneck.
f9_nk_domain_candidates.testable_frontier: F-PRO-NK1: Track bridge-file NK composite score over sessions. Prediction: as bridges grow in size, composite score increases faster than N due to coupling density. Test: version-compare bridge NK metrics S186 → current.
f9_nk_domain_candidates.priority: MEDIUM — F-GOV2 (bridge drift) is already tracked; NK provides quantitative bridge coupling metric to complement drift detection

f9_nk_domain_candidates.coupling_structure: Genesis variant citation graph (how spawn generations cite parent-session findings, cross-variant harvest records)
f9_nk_domain_candidates.K_avg_measured: unmeasured — cross-variant harvest logs not parsed as NK graph
f9_nk_domain_candidates.cycles_measured: unmeasured — variant contamination not structurally detected
f9_nk_domain_candidates.architecture: UNKNOWN — requires parsing evolution experiment artifacts
f9_nk_domain_candidates.what_we_found: Cross-variant harvest R8 (MEMORY.md) identified K≈27k convergence across brain + linguistics — this is an NK threshold finding applied to swarm capacity, not to the genesis spawn graph itself. The spawn/harvest dependency chain is an unexplored NK object.
f9_nk_domain_candidates.nk_prediction: Healthy genesis tree = low K_avg (variants independent, DAG from parent to child). High K_avg in genesis citation graph = variant contamination (child borrows too much from sibling). Cycle = selection failure (variant A validates B validates A).
f9_nk_domain_candidates.testable_frontier: F-EVO-NK1: Parse evolution experiment artifacts to build genesis session dependency graph. Compute K_avg and cycle count. Prediction: K_avg < 0.5 (healthy independence), zero cycles.
f9_nk_domain_candidates.priority: MEDIUM — genesis contamination is a known risk; NK provides a structural early warning metric

f9_nk_domain_candidates.coupling_structure: Lesson vocabulary co-occurrence graph (word X co-appears with word Y in same lesson body across the 401-lesson corpus)
f9_nk_domain_candidates.K_avg_measured: unmeasured — would require word co-occurrence computation
f9_nk_domain_candidates.cycles_measured: N/A — word co-occurrence is inherently undirected
f9_nk_domain_candidates.architecture: UNKNOWN — Zipf predicts power-law degree distribution
f9_nk_domain_candidates.what_we_found: F-LNG1 Zipf analysis (alpha=0.7476 at N=401) demonstrates the lesson vocabulary follows a power law. NK analysis of word coupling would test whether the hub words (MDL, compression, beliefs, swarm, session) have K >> mean — directly testable via co-occurrence matrix.
f9_nk_domain_candidates.nk_prediction: If Zipf holds, then word-level K follows power law too: top-10 vocabulary hubs have K 10-100x mean. This is the linguistic dual of the citation graph's hub structure (L-001 with in-degree=22). Empirical test would either confirm or break the isomorphism.
f9_nk_domain_candidates.testable_frontier: F-LNG-NK1: Compute word co-occurrence K_avg for lesson corpus. Compare hub-degree distribution to citation graph hub-degree. Prediction: same power-law slope (alpha ~1.7) if iso holds.
f9_nk_domain_candidates.priority: LOW — interesting structural validation but no direct operational implication; linguistics domain is already well-characterized by F-LNG1/F-LNG2

sink_thematic_distribution.comment: NK/complexity lessons are the largest uncited cluster (34% of sinks). These are lessons about specific packages, tool runs, and experimental results — hard to cite because they are highly specific.

option_A_spot_edit.method: Edit existing high-outgoing lessons to add 1-3 citations to sinks
option_A_spot_edit.risk: Edits may feel forced if semantic connection is weak; violates citation quality principle

option_B_synthesis_lessons.method: Write new thematic synthesis lessons that cite 5-10 sinks each
option_B_synthesis_lessons.risk: Adds to N (dilutes K_avg slightly); each new lesson is itself a sink until cited

option_C_hybrid.method: 5-10 synthesis lessons targeting 40-80 sinks + spot-cite remaining via existing lessons that have clear semantic links
option_C_hybrid.K_avg_impact: Neutral to positive: citations added > new N dilution
option_C_hybrid.key_constraint: New lessons must cite >= 2 existing lessons (quality gate) AND themselves be cited within 2 sessions

highest_priority_sinks.note: NK-related sinks are highest priority because NK domain already has network neighbors to cite them
highest_priority_sinks.strategy: A new lesson on 'NK analysis applied to non-software coupling structures' (governance, protocol, evolution) can naturally cite 10-15 of these NK sinks

k_avg_sustainability.assessment: K_avg=1.5611 is self-sustaining. With N growing at ~3 lessons/session and each new lesson averaging 2-3 outgoing citations (quality gate), K_avg will stay above 1.5 without sprint intervention until approximately N=500.
k_avg_sustainability.concern: Sink fraction (~39%) is the remaining structural weakness. It does not directly threaten K_avg but represents latent graph connectivity below what K_avg implies.
k_avg_sustainability.next_milestone: Track K_avg and sink% at N=450. Run hybrid sprint if sink% rises above 45%.

conclusions: 5 domains identified with NK-analyzable coupling structures: governance (authority chain), operations-research (lane deps), protocol-engineering (bridge mesh), evolution (genesis graph), linguistics (vocab co-occurrence)
Governance and operations-research are highest priority (direct coordination quality impact); protocol-engineering medium; evolution and linguistics lower
Protocol bridge files form a K_avg=4.17 full-mesh — expected for peers, but signals high per-file maintenance burden as bridges grow
Governance authority chain K_avg=2.86 with 4 cycles — NEXT.md is the K=6 hub, creates bottleneck; cycles in authority chain create precedence ambiguity risk
Sink sprint: 158 sinks (39.4%), thematically clustered (34% NK/complexity, 22% governance, 18% meta-coordination)
Recommended sprint strategy: hybrid (5-10 synthesis lessons targeting 50-100 sinks) rather than spot edits or pure new-lesson writing
K_avg=1.5611 is self-sustaining — no emergency sprint needed; schedule hybrid sink sprint at N=450 if sink% exceeds 45%
new_frontiers_proposed: F-GOV-NK1: correlation between governance authority chain K_avg and drift/enforcement events
F-OPS-NK1: lane dependency graph K_avg and cycle count as deadlock predictor
F-PRO-NK1: track bridge-file NK composite score over sessions as maintenance burden metric
F-EVO-NK1: genesis session dependency graph — test for K_avg < 0.5 and zero cycles
F-LNG-NK1: word co-occurrence K_avg vs citation graph alpha — structural iso test
